Posts.Content: hi ali i am new to this website also and your post is the first one ive read and so sounds like myself i was diagnosed with idc grade 3 on the 20 june age 32 i am having my chemo first and had first one on 6 july from getting diagnosed to my big consultation a week later i thought i was going mad every niggle every ache i thought (no i was sure) it was spreading round my body it was undeniably the most terrifying wait of my life while just trying to carry on with my work kids and well just normality i have to praise the nurses and all my support team friends and family for getting me through that time but i can assure you that once treatment starts the survival instinct kicks in i have only had one chemo and i feel the strongesst i have ever felt in my life i am back in control :) i even shaved my hair off yesterday as it was getting sore and i was keeping control of when i lost it it was important to me i have cancer, cancer will not have me !! please be strong i know its a cliche but things will get easier to process i just want you to know i am thinking of you and yes you are normal as i have been where you are right now and know how it hurts sending all my love xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed and freaking out!
